alert.note: Alert for Iowa (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 05 at 7:07PM CST until March 05 at 11:00PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CST FOR NORTHWESTERN JOHNSON...SOUTHEASTERN BENTON...SOUTHERN LINN AND NORTHEASTERN IOWA COUNTIES... At 706 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located over Fairfax, or 7 miles southwest of Cedar Rapids, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Cedar Rapids, Marion, Hiawatha, Mount Vernon, Robins, Fairfax, Ely, Walford, Swisher, Shueyville, Norway, Bertram, Amana, Middle Amana, Homestead, Cou Falls, Squaw Creek Park, East Amana, Marion Airport and Palisades-Kepler State Park. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CST for east central Iowa. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building.
